Article.ArticleTitle: Au/SBA-15 catalyst prepared by ozone treatment and importance of negatively charged gold in CO oxidation by DRIFTS.

AbstractText: There is a lack of consensus on the charge state of active gold species in catalytic CO oxidation reaction. Herein, Au/SBA-15 catalyst was prepared by room temperature ozone treatment. Through diffuse reflectance Fourier-transform infrared spectroscopy (DRIFTS), two different gold species, Au<sup>0</sup> and Au<sup>δ-</sup> with CO adsorption at about 2112 cm<sup>-1</sup> and 2077 cm<sup>-1</sup>, were observed on Au/SBA-15. In CO oxidation mixture, the 2077 cm<sup>-1</sup> band is completely attenuated while the 2112 cm<sup>-1</sup> band retains some intensity. CO-Au<sup>δ-</sup> bonding is weaker than that of CO-Au<sup>0</sup>, but CO-Au<sup>δ-</sup> exhibits higher reactivity towards oxygen. Ozone treatment produces AuO<sub>x</sub> nanoparticles that is not stable and decomposes to metallic Au gradually. To our best knowledge, this is the first time to identify the presence and importance of Au<sup>δ-</sup> species for "inert" SiO<sub>2</sub> supported gold catalyst.
